> Check your answers in [Exercise 1](02_09_01.html) by using Equation (2.7) or Theorem 2.3. 
>
> a)

$$P^{R}(2, 5) = 2^5 = `r n <- 2^5; n`$$

> b)

$$P^{R}(3, 2) = 3^2 = `r n <- 3^2; n`$$

> c)

$$C^{R}(2, 5) = C(6, 5) = \binom{6}{5} = `r n <- choose(6, 5); n`$$

> d)

$$C^{R}(3, 2) = C(4, 2) = \binom{4}{2} = `r n <- choose(4, 2); n`$$
